creator: ronzlin@yahoo.com
text:
I hope I am wrong on this, because I have been using Tomcat
only couple weeks but I think this is bug on servlets.
I did not find this issue in bugzilla.
I have Tomcat v4.0 running on Intel and Win NT4.0.
I have written servlet.
The servlet doGet() calls another.methodX() of another class in line2 of 
doGet().
The methodX throws an exception.
The exception is not processed correctly in doGet.
That is, the execution flows continues from line2 in doGet(),
to line3, line4, etc, instead transferred to catch clause in doGet.
Any comments requested.

creator: remm@apache.org
text:
The bugzilla database is for confirmed bugs (or at least when you are reasonably
sure you found a bug). Catalina can't do anything to change the Java exception
processing, so I think you made a mistake somewhere. User questions should be
posted on tomcat-user.
